thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 29 Jan 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: BRIEF-Moody's says UK companies' credit quality will remain stable in 2018, despite Brexit uncertainty

author: Reuters Editorial
title: BRIEF-Moody's says UK companies' credit quality will remain stable in 2018, despite Brexit uncertainty
text:
Jan 29 (Reuters) - Moody‘s:
* MOODY‘S SAYS UK COMPANIES’ CREDIT QUALITY WILL REMAIN STABLE IN 2018, DESPITE BREXIT UNCERTAINTY‍​
* MOODY‘S SAYS VIEW REMAINS THAT SOME FORM OF FREE TRADE AGREEMENT COVERING GOODS WILL BE REACHED BECAUSE IT‘S IN INTERESTS OF BOTH UK AND EUROPEAN UNION
* MOODY‘S SAYS EXPECTS THE UK TELECOMS MARKET TO PROVIDE A STABLE CREDIT ENVIRONMENT FOR THE MAJOR PARTICIPANTS: BT, VODAFONE AND VIRGIN MEDIA‍​
* MOODY'S SAYS ALTHOUGH BREXIT TALKS LIKELY TO CREATE SOME VOLATILITY IN CREDIT MARKETS, EXPECT STEADY DEBT ISSUANCE IN 2018, SUPPORTED BY REFINANCING,RESURGENT M&A‍​ Source: bit.ly/2DXaU5C Further company coverage:,
